Article.ArticleTitle: Spatiotemporal prediction of daily ambient ozone levels across China using random forest for human exposure assessment.

AbstractText: In China, ozone pollution shows an increasing trend and becomes the primary air pollutant in warm seasons. Leveraging the air quality monitoring network, a random forest model is developed to predict the daily maximum 8-h average ozone concentrations ([O<sub>3</sub>]<sub>MDA8</sub>) across China in 2015 for human exposure assessment. This model captures the observed spatiotemporal variations of [O<sub>3</sub>]<sub>MDA8</sub> by using the data of meteorology, elevation, and recent-year emission inventories (cross-validation R<sup>2</sup> = 0.69 and RMSE = 26 μg/m<sup>3</sup>). Compared with chemical transport models that require a plenty of variables and expensive computation, the random forest model shows comparable or higher predictive performance based on only a handful of readily-available variables at much lower computational cost. The nationwide population-weighted [O<sub>3</sub>]<sub>MDA8</sub> is predicted to be 84 ± 23 μg/m<sup>3</sup> annually, with the highest seasonal mean in the summer (103 ± 8 μg/m<sup>3</sup>). The summer [O<sub>3</sub>]<sub>MDA8</sub> is predicted to be the highest in North China (125 ± 17 μg/m<sup>3</sup>). Approximately 58% of the population lives in areas with more than 100 nonattainment days ([O<sub>3</sub>]<sub>MDA8</sub>>100 μg/m<sup>3</sup>), and 12% of the population are exposed to [O<sub>3</sub>]<sub>MDA8</sub>>160 μg/m<sup>3</sup> (WHO Interim Target 1) for more than 30 days. As the most populous zones in China, the Beijing-Tianjin Metro, Yangtze River Delta, Pearl River Delta, and Sichuan Basin are predicted to be at 154, 141, 124, and 98 nonattainment days, respectively. Effective controls of O<sub>3</sub> pollution are urgently needed for the highly-populated zones, especially the Beijing-Tianjin Metro with seasonal [O<sub>3</sub>]<sub>MDA8</sub> of 140 ± 29 μg/m<sup>3</sup> in summer. To the best of the authors' knowledge, this study is the first statistical modeling work of ambient O<sub>3</sub> for China at the national level. This timely and extensively validated [O<sub>3</sub>]<sub>MDA8</sub> dataset is valuable for refining epidemiological analyses on O<sub>3</sub> pollution in China.
